title: Alibaba has lost $344 billion in world's biggest wipeout
writtenTitle: Alibaba has lost $344 billion in world's biggest wipeout
summary:
After Jack Ma delivered a blunt criticism of China’s financial system last October, Alibaba has lost a whopping $344 billion in market capitalisation in a year.
Alibaba shares sank from an all-time high that month to a record low three weeks ago in Hong Kong.
Despite a 30% recovery from Oct. 5, the stock is still 43% lower than its October 2020 peak.
writtenSummary:
After Jack Ma delivered a blunt criticism of China’s financial system last October, Alibaba has lost a whopping $344 billion in market capitalization in a year.
Alibaba shares sank from an all-time high that month to a record low three weeks ago in Hong Kong.
Despite a 30% recovery from Oct. 5, the stock is still 43% lower than its October 2020 peak.

title: Facebook is spending $10 billion on its metaverse division
writtenTitle: Facebook is spending $10 billion this year on its metaverse division
summary:
Facebook will spend at least $10 bn this year on Facebook Reality Labs, its metaverse division tasked with creating AR and VR hardware, software and content.
The division is clearly being positioned as the next big thing inside of Facebook.
Facebook missed revenue expectations by around $1 bn, which highlights the company’s struggles right now.
writtenSummary:
Facebook will spend at least $10 B this year on Facebook Reality Labs, its metaverse division tasked with creating AR and VR hardware, software, and content.
The division is clearly being positioned as the next big thing inside of Facebook.
Facebook missed revenue expectations by around $1 B, which speaks to some of the company’s struggles right now.

title: Spain discovers two mass graves of Civil War victims in Belchite
writtenTitle: Spain discovers two mass graves of Civil War victims in Belchite
summary:
The graves were found after archaeological excavations at a cemetery in Belchite, in the northern province of Zaragoza.
The site was the bloodiest battlefield during the Spanish Civil War between 1936 - 1939.
Anthropologist described the discovery as "very important" and said "meticulous" work would be carried out to identify the victims.
writtenSummary:
The graves were found after archaeological excavations at a cemetery in Belchite, in the northern province of Zaragoza.
The site was the bloodiest battlefield during the Spanish Civil War between 1936 - 1939.
Anthropologist described the discovery as "very important" and said "meticulous" work would be carried out to identify the victims.

title: Nigeria becomes first African nation to roll out digital currency
writtenTitle: Nigeria becomes first African nation to roll out digital currency
summary:
The Central Bank of Nigeria joined a growing list of emerging markets betting on digital money to cut transaction costs and boost participation in the formal financial system.
Its Governor said eNaira and the physical naira will have the same value.
Digital currency is expected to boost cross-border trade and make transactions more efficient.
writtenSummary:
The Central Bank of Nigeria joined a growing list of emerging markets betting on digital money to cut transaction costs and boost participation in the formal financial system.
Its Governor said eNaira and the physical naira will have the same value.
Digital currency is expected to boost cross-border trade and make transactions more efficient.

title: Climate change: Australia pledges net zero emissions by 2050
writtenTitle: Climate change: Australia pledges net zero emissions by 2050
summary:
Leading global coal and gas supplier Australia has pledged to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050.
PM Morrison said the plan would not include ending fossil fuel sectors and will also not set ambitious targets for 2030.
While the 2050 pledge has been widely welcomed, the govt has been ferociously criticised for not offering more details.
writtenSummary:
Leading global coal and gas supplier Australia has pledged to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050.
PM Morrison said the plan would not include ending fossil fuel sectors and will also not set ambitious targets for 2030.
While the 2050 pledge has been widely welcomed, the govt has been ferociously criticised for not offering more details.

title: Astronomers find signs of first planet outside our galaxy
writtenTitle: Astronomers found signs of first planet outside our galaxy
summary:
A Saturn-sized planet discovered by Nasa's Chandra X-Ray Telescope is in the Messier 51 galaxy, located 28 million light-years away from the Milky Way.
The finding comes from observation of an X-ray binary, a neutron star or black hole pulling in gas from a companion star.
So far 5,000 exoplanets have been found, but all are located in the Milky Way.
writtenSummary:
A Saturn-sized planet discovered by Nasa's Chandra X-Ray Telescope is in the Messier 51 galaxy, located 28 million light-years away from the Milky Way.
The finding comes from observation of an X-ray binary - a neutron star or black hole pulling in gas from a companion star.
So far 5,000 exoplanets were found, but all are located in the Milky Way.

title: Blue Origin wants to build a space station for "exotic hospitality"
writtenTitle: Blue Origin wants to build a space station for "exotic hospitality"
summary:
Orbital Reef would host astronauts and be used to conduct science experiments.
It would also be used as an in-space manufacturing facility and offer accommodation for tourists as part of exotic hospitality service.
With the ISS likely to be decommissioned within the next 10 years, Orbital Reef would arrive in time to replace the ageing satellite.
writtenSummary:
Orbital Reef would host astronauts and be used to conduct science experiments.
It would also be used as an in-space manufacturing facility and offer accommodation for tourists as part of exotic hospitality service.
With the ISS likely to be decommissioned within the next 10 years, Orbital Reef would arrive in time to replace the ageing satellite.

title: Covid-19 vaccines not linked to pregnancy loss
writtenTitle: COVID-19 vaccines not linked to pregnancy loss
summary:
Researchers found no link between vaccines and risk of first-trimester miscarriage, regardless of whether the vaccines were from Moderna, Pfizer and BioNTech or AZ.
Overall, the women with miscarriages were 9% less likely to have been vaccinated.
Vaccination during pregnancy is likely to offer protection to the infant in the first months after birth.
writtenSummary:
Researchers found no link between vaccines and risk of first-trimester miscarriage, regardless of whether the vaccines were from Moderna, Pfizer and BioNTech or AZ.
Overall, the women with miscarriages were 9% less likely to have been vaccinated.
Vaccination during pregnancy is likely to offer protection to the infant in the first months after birth.

title: Roche launches genomic profiling kit to ease cancer research
writtenTitle: Roche launches genomic profiling kit to ease cancer research
summary:
Roche is launching a new genomic profiling kit that lets researchers explore tumours without having to send tissue samples to centralised laboratories.
The kit allows labs to expand their oncology research in-house.
Ultimately, a future version of the kit may lead to additional resources for clinicians to use in the diagnosis and treatment of cancer.
writtenSummary:
Roche is launching a new genomic profiling kit that lets researchers explore tumours without having to send tissue samples to centralised laboratories.
The kit allows labs to expand their oncology research in-house.
Ultimately, a future version of the kit may lead to additional resources for clinicians to use in the diagnosis and treatment of cancer.

title: Remains of "Big John", largest known triceratops, fetch nearly $8 mn
writtenTitle: Remains of "Big John", largest known triceratops, fetch nearly $8 mn
summary:
A private, anonymous US collector recently bought the fossilised remains of "Big John" for 6.65 million euros ($7.74 million) at a Paris auction.
Big John roamed modern-day South Dakota more than 66 million years ago.
The first piece of bone from the supersized skeleton - the skull alone is 2.62 meters long and two meters wide - was found in 2014.
writtenSummary:
A private, anonymous US collector recently bought the fossilised remains of "Big John" for 6.65 million euros ($7.74 million) at a Paris auction. 
Big John roamed modern-day South Dakota more than 66 million years ago. 
The first piece of bone from the supersized skeleton - the skull alone is 2.62 meters long and two meters wide - was found in 2014.

title: Public sector workers set for pay rise
writtenTitle: Budget 2021: Public sector workers set for pay rise
summary:
Millions of public sector workers will see a rise in wages next year after the government confirmed the pay freeze is being lifted.
The Chancellor will use his Budget to say nurses, teachers and members of the armed forces are among the beneficiaries.
A temporary pause in salary progression was introduced last November as a response to the pandemic.
writtenSummary:
Millions of public sector workers will see a rise in wages next year after the government confirmed the pay freeze is being lifted.
The Chancellor will use his Budget to say nurses, teachers and members of the armed forces are among the beneficiaries.
A temporary pause in salary progression was introduced last November as a response to the pandemic.

title: No VAT cut to household energy bills in the Budget
writtenTitle: No VAT cut to household energy bills in the Budget
summary:
VAT on household energy bills will not be cut in the Chancellor's Budget on Wednesday, despite calls to help families struggling with soaring prices.
Labour has been calling for the rate to be slashed from 5% to zero for the next six months to help households get through a tough winter.
However, sources said such a move would be poorly targeted.
writtenSummary:
VAT on household energy bills will not be cut in the Chancellor's Budget on Wednesday, despite calls to help families struggling with soaring prices.
Labour has been calling for the rate to be slashed from 5% to zero for the next six months to help households get through a tough winter.
However, sources said such a move would be poorly targeted.

writtenTitle: Blue Origin: Jeff Bezos unveils plans for 'space business park'
summary:
Blue Origin, the space tourism company owned by Jeff Bezos, has announced plans to launch a commercial space station.
Bosses said on Monday that they hope to operate the station, named "Orbital Reef," by the end of the decade.
Promotional material released by the company claims the station will be a mixed-use business park in space.
writtenSummary:

writtenTitle: Covid vaccines: Paediatricians on frontlines of child jab plan
summary:
Paediatricians could soon be a part of the US government’s plan to get some 28 mn school-aged children in line for their Covid jabs.
FDA and CDC Advisory boards will meet to discuss authorising the Pfizer vaccine for 5-11 years olds.
Data from the company's clinical trials found that 1/3rd of the dose given to adults and adolescents was effective.

title: Tesla surpasses $1 trillion valuation after Hertz order
writtenTitle: Tesla surpasses $1 trillion valuation after Hertz order
summary:
Tesla surpassed a market value of $1 trillion on Monday, making it the fifth such firm to reach the milestone.
Shares in the electric carmaker climbed 12.6% after it struck a deal to sell 100,000 vehicles to the car rental firm Hertz.
Tesla has been the world's most valuable carmaker for some time, but brands like Ford and GM make more cars.

title: World has wasted chance to "build back better" after Covid, UN says
writtenTitle: World has wasted chance to ‘build back better’ after Covid, UN says
summary:
The world needs to reduce emissions to meet the goals of the Paris climate agreement.
If the world warms up at a rate dictated by current policies, there will be an "abrupt jump" in the pace of Antarctic ice loss around 2060.
This could cause a cascading effect where huge amounts of ice and water flow uninterrupted into the Southern Ocean.

title: Queen carries out first official engagements since hospital stay
writtenTitle: Queen carries out first official engagements since hospital stay
summary:
The Queen has carried out virtual audiences from Windsor Castle, her first official engagements in seven days.
It is the first time the 95-year-old head of state has been seen since the global investment summit on 19 October.
She cancelled a trip to Northern Ireland on 20 October during her first overnight stay at a medical facility in eight years.

summary:

The government has said it will focus on ramping up booster jabs for the over-50s, vulnerable adults and those aged 12 to 16.
Johnson has so far resisted more widespread mask-wearing and the extended use of vaccine passports.

title: Indians await WHO nod for homegrown shot to travel abroad
writtenTitle: COVID: Indians await WHO nod for homegrown shot to travel abroad
summary:
Millions of Indians have taken Covaxin and many have complained of travel struggles as the vaccine has not been recognised for international travel by several countries.
Without a WHO nod, the two-dose Covaxin is unlikely to be accepted as a valid vaccine globally.
The WHO is expected to take a final call on an emergency-use listing for Covaxin.

writtenTitle: Massive cyberattack disrupts petrol stations in Iran
summary:
A significant cyberattack hit Iran’s online petrol distribution system affecting thousand’s of fuel stations and causing long lineups.
The widespread attack came shortly before the second anniversary of the Nov 2019 nationwide protests against an overnight petrol price rise.
Authorities said the origins of the hack were under investigation.
writtenSummary:
A significant cyberattack hit Iran’s online petrol distribution system affecting thousand’s of fuel stations and causing long lineups.
The widespread attack came shortly before the second anniversary of the Nov 2019 nationwide protests against an overnight petrol price rise.
Authorities said the origins of the hack were under investigation.

title: US revokes licence of top Chinese telecoms company
writtenTitle: US revokes licence of top Chinese telecoms company
summary:
Washington has revoked the US licence of one of China's biggest telecoms companies citing "national security" concerns.
China Telecom must stop providing services in America within 60 days.
Officials said the Chinese government's control of the company gave it the opportunity "to access, store, disrupt, and/or misroute US communications".
writtenSummary:
Washington has revoked the US licence of one of China's biggest telecoms companies citing "national security" concerns.
China Telecom must stop providing services in America within 60 days.
Officials said the Chinese government's control of the company gave it the opportunity "to access, store, disrupt, and/or misroute US communications".

title: Canada: PM Justin Trudeau unveils new cabinet
writtenTitle: Canada: PM Justin Trudeau unveils new cabinet
summary:
PM Trudeau has unveiled his third cabinet since first winning office in 2015, replacing the defence minister and environment minister.
The new cabinet has 38 members, including the prime minister.
His govt looks to emerge from the pandemic, improve its environmental record and fend off political challenges from rival parties.
writtenSummary:
PM Trudeau has unveiled his third cabinet since first winning office in 2015, replacing the defence minister and environment minister.
The new cabinet has 38 members, including the prime minister.
His govt looks to emerge from the pandemic, improve its environmental record and fend off political challenges from rival parties.t

title: Lebanese urge end to "campaign" against Beirut blast judge
writtenTitle: Lebanese urge end to "campaign" against Beirut blast judge
summary:
Lebanon’s media landscape is heavily controlled by political parties and leaders.
Rights groups, lawyers and journalists have called for "honest" reporting on the Beirut Port explosion investigation in the media.
Political officials have lodged several unsuccessful legal complaints to remove the lead investigating judge, Tarek Bitar, from the probe.

title: "Lost a great sportsman": Ecuador’s Olympic sprinter shot dead
writtenTitle: "Lost a great sportsman": Ecuador’s Olympic sprinter shot dead
summary:
Alex Quinonez and another person were found dead on Friday, with the killing sparking an outpouring of grief in a country struggling to contain a surge in violence.
President Lasso has promised to bring his killers to justice.
Between January and October this year, Ecuador registered almost 1,900 homicides, compared with about 1,400 in all of 2020.
writtenSummary:
Alex Quinonez and another person were found dead on Friday, with the killing sparking an outpouring of grief in a country struggling to contain a surge in violence. 
President Lasso has promised to bring his killers to justice. 
Between January and October this year, Ecuador registered almost 1,900 homicides, compared with about 1,400 in all of 2020.

title: Brazil: Facebook, YouTube remove Bolsonaro video over vaccine claims
writtenTitle: Brazil: Facebook, YouTube remove Bolsonaro video over vaccine claims
summary:
Facebook and YouTube have removed from their platforms a video by Bolsonaro in which the president made a false claim that Covid-19 vaccines were linked with developing AIDS.
YouTube has suspended Bolsonaro for 7 days.
Last January, Bolsonaro had said that he would not be taking any vaccine, but he did pledge to quickly inoculate all Brazilians.
writtenSummary:
Facebook and YouTube have removed from their platforms a video by Bolsonaro in which the president made a false claim that COVID-19 vaccines were linked with developing AIDS.
YouTube has suspended Bolsonaro for 7 days.
While Bolsonaro himself last January said that he would not be taking any vaccine, he did pledge to quickly inoculate all Brazilians.

title: Missing black people: mother calls for public inquiry
writtenTitle: Missing black people: mother calls for public inquiry
summary:
Mother of Richard Okorogheye called for a public inquiry into missing black people reports.
In England and Wales in 2019-20, black people made up 14% of missing incidents, but are just 3% of the population.
Metropolitan police failed the family of two black sisters - disappeared and murdered, Independent Office for Police Conduct (IOPC) says.
writtenSummary:
Mother of Richard Okorogheye called for a public inquiry into missing black people reports.
In England and Wales in 2019-20, black people made up 14% of missing incidents, but are just 3% of the population.

title: Why pregnant women need clearer messaging on Covid vaccine safety
writtenTitle: Why pregnant women need clearer messaging on Covid vaccine safety
summary:
Covid risks for pregnant women increase because their immune system is suppressed.
Another reason is that, as the baby gets bigger it affects the mother’s lungs making breathing and clearing infections harder.
Pregnant women with Covid have a one in five chance of delivering their baby prematurely and an increased risk of stillbirth.
writtenSummary:
COVID risks for pregnant women increase because their immune system is suppressed.
While pregnant is that, as the baby gets bigger and affects the mother’s lungs making breathing and clearing infections harder.
Pregnant women with Covid have a one in five chance of delivering their baby prematurely and an increased risk of stillbirth.

title: Climate change: Four things you can do to help the planet
writtenTitle: Climate change: Four things you can do to help the planet
summary:
From installing a heat pump to turning down the heating, there is a raft of changes around the home that can help the planet.
Cut out food waste and cut down on red meat; livestock creates 14% of all greenhouse gases.
Drive less, fly less and think before you buy, and choosing the right household appliances can also have a positive effect.
writtenSummary:
From installing a heat pump to turning down the heating, there is a raft of changes around the home that can help the planet.
Cut out food waste and cut down on red meat. Livestock creates 14% of all greenhouse gases. 
Drive less, fly less and think before you buy. BBC explores 4 ways in which anyone can lower their carbon footprint.

title: Charlottesville: White supremacist on trial
writtenTitle: Charlottesville: White supremacist on trial
summary:
Over four years after the deadly extremist rally in Virginia, US, organisers of the event are facing a civil trial to determine whether they should be held responsible.
The "Unite the Right" rally took place in August 2017, in Charlottesville.
An alleged neo-Nazi ploughed into counter-protesters with his car, killing one and injuring dozens.
writtenSummary:
Over four years after the deadly extremist rally in Virginia, organisers of the event are facing a civil trial to determine whether they should be held responsible.

title: Sudan's ousted Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok returns home
writtenTitle: Sudan coup: Ousted Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok returns home
summary:
PM Hamdok has returned home with his wife on Tuesday evening after being detained by General Abdel-Fattah Burhan.
A military official said that Hamdok's house in the upscale Kafouri neighbourhood of Khartoum was under heavy security.
Several people have been killed and at least 140 wounded in violent clashes between soldiers and protesting civilians.
writtenSummary:
PM Hamdok has returned home with his wife on Tuesday evening after being detained by General Abdel-Fattah Burhan.
A military official said that Hamdok's house in the upscale Kafouri neighbourhood of Khartoum was under heavy security.
Several people have been killed and at least 140 wounded in violent clashes between soldiers and protesting civilians.

title: Somalia climate migrants struggling in cities
writtenTitle: Somalia climate migrants struggling in cities
summary:
Thousands of climate migrants are on the move in Somalia, where environmental extremes are forcing herders and farmers off the land toward cities ill-equipped to host them.
Recently, natural disasters have been the main driver of displacement in Somalia.
A report says frequent droughts and floods have uprooted over three million Somalis since 2016.
writtenSummary:
Thousands of climate migrants are on the move in Somalia, where environmental extremes are forcing herders and farmers off the land toward cities ill-equipped to host them.
Recently, natural disasters have been the main driver of displacement in Somalia.
A report says frequent droughts and floods have uprooted over three million Somalis since 2016.

title: Germany begins new parliamentary era
writtenTitle: Germany begins new parliamentary era
summary:
Germany's 20th legislative period began with a five-hour session in the Bundestag.
Though Chancellor Merkel remains in office, her normal seat at the front of the govt benches was empty, waiting to be filled by a successor currently being negotiated in the ongoing coalition talks.
The morning session was led by outgoing Bundestag President Schäuble.
writtenSummary:
Germany's 20th legislative period began with a five-hour session in the Bundestag.
Though Chancellor Merkel remains in office, her normal seat at the front of the govt benches was empty, waiting to be filled by a successor currently being negotiated in the ongoing coalition talks.
The morning session was led by outgoing Bundestag President Schäuble.

title: Israeli con artist wanted in Germany arrested in the Philippines
writtenTitle: Israeli con artist wanted in Germany arrested in the Philippines
summary:
Kfir, who was wanted in Germany avoided detection in the Philippines for over a year before being arrested in Manila.
He is suspected of stealing millions of euros from unsuspecting victims via a fake online trading platform.
As the world went into pandemic lockdowns, he managed to overstay his tourist visa in the Philippines.
writtenSummary:
Kfir, who was wanted in Germany avoided detection in the Philippines for over a year before being arrested in Manila.

title: Uganda says bus blast victim was suicide bomber
writtenTitle: Uganda says bus blast victim was suicide bomber
summary:
Police announced that the Monday explosion that killed a person and injured several others on a bus near Kampala was the result of a suicide attack.
The suicide bomber was on the wanted list of the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF) group.
The attack was claimed by the Islamic State in Central Africa group, which presents the ADF as its regional branch.
writtenSummary:
Police announced that the Monday explosion that killed a person and injured several others on a bus near Kampala was the result of a suicide attack.
The suicide bomber was on the wanted list of the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF) group.
The attack was claimed by the Islamic State in Central Africa group, which presents the ADF as its regional branch.

title: Moldova gets first non-Russian gas delivery amid energy crisis battle
writtenTitle: Moldova gets first non-Russian gas delivery amid energy crisis battle
summary:
One million cubic metres of natural gas was supplied by Poland's PGNiG to Moldova.
The offer from PGNiG was one of seven, the state company Energocom received after issuing a tender.
The delivery came four days after Moldova declared a one-month state of emergency to secure gas supplies amid a crisis over rising prices.
writtenSummary:
One million cubic metres of natural gas was supplied by Poland's PGNiG to Moldova.
The offer from PGNiG was one of seven, the state company Energocom received after issuing a tender.
The delivery came four days after Moldova declared a one-month state of emergency to secure gas supplies amid a crisis over rising prices.

title: Australia to end ban on citizens leaving country
writtenTitle: Covid: Australia to end ban on citizens leaving country
summary:
From 1st Nov fully vaccinated people in Australia will no longer need an exemption to leave the country.
The govt said only Australians are eligible but some rules for foreigners will be relaxed soon.
Home Affairs Minister said, “Before the end of the year, we anticipate welcoming fully vaccinated skilled workers and international students."
writtenSummary:
From 1st Nov fully vaccinated people in Australia will no longer need an exemption to leave the country.
The govt said only Australians are eligible but some rules for foreigners will be relaxed soon.
Home Affairs Minister said, “Before the end of the year, we anticipate welcoming fully vaccinated skilled workers and international students."

title: Insulate Britain: Protesters block roads leading to M25
writtenTitle: Insulate Britain: Protesters block roads leading to M25
summary:
Insulate Britain protesters blocked major roads connecting to the M25 despite a new court injunction.
About 50 demonstrators from the environmental group have been arrested at three sites, including on the A40 in west London during rush hour.
They also blocked the A206 at Crossways Boulevard in Dartford, though traffic is now moving in the area.
writtenSummary:
‘Insulate Britain’ protesters blocked major roads connecting to the M25 despite a new court injunction.
About 50 demonstrators from the environmental group have been arrested at three sites, including on the A40 in west London during rush hour.
They also blocked the A206 at Crossways Boulevard in Dartford, though traffic is now moving in the area.

title: UK: Sunak promises new post-Covid economy
writtenTitle: Budget 2021: Sunak promises new post-Covid economy
summary:
UK’s Chancellor, Rishi Sunak has told MPs the Budget begins the work to prepare for a new economy post the Covid-19 pandemic, as he delivers his speech in the Commons.
Spending plans for transport, health and education have been unveiled in the press.
Sunak is under pressure to help people with the cost of living.
writtenSummary:
UK’s Chancellor, Rishi Sunak has told MPs the Budget begins the work to prepare for a new economy post the Covid-19 pandemic, as he delivers his speech in the Commons.

title: Actress Maureen Lipman becomes Coronation Street's first dame
writtenTitle: Actress Maureen Lipman becomes Coronation Street's first dame
summary:
Actress Maureen Lipman became the first dame of Coronation Street, after receiving the honour from the Prince of Wales at Windsor Castle.
She is the first serving actor in the ITV soap's 60-year history to receive a damehood or a knighthood.
The 75-year-old has played Evelyn Plummer since 2018, part of a career spanning more than 50 years.
writtenSummary:
Actress Maureen Lipman became the first dame of Coronation Street, after receiving the honour from the Prince of Wales at Windsor Castle.
She is the first serving actor in the ITV soap's 60-year history to receive a damehood or a knighthood.
The 75-year-old has played Evelyn Plummer since 2018, part of a career spanning more than 50 years.

title: New funding plan paves way for Sizewell C nuclear plant
writtenTitle: New funding plan paves way for Sizewell C nuclear plant
summary:
Funding rules pave the way for a new major nuclear power station have been announced by the Business and Energy Secretary, Kwasi Kwarteng.
The move is the latest stage in efforts to build the £20bn Sizewell C project in Suffolk.
The proposed plant is still subject to planning approval, but until now, the Treasury has been uncertain of how to pay.
writtenSummary:
Funding rules pave the way for a new major nuclear power station have been announced by the Business and Energy Secretary, Kwasi Kwarteng.
The move is the latest stage in efforts to build the £20bn Sizewell C project in Suffolk.
The proposed plant is still subject to planning approval, but until now, the Treasury has been uncertain of how to pay.

title: Ivory poaching has led to evolution of tuskless elephants, study finds
writtenTitle: Ivory poaching has led to evolution of tuskless elephants, study finds
summary:
Ivory poaching has led to the evolution of tuskless elephants, proving that humans are “changing the anatomy” of wild animals.
Elephants with tusks were highly likely to be hunted during the Mozambican civil war.
Those without tusks were left alone, leading to an increased likelihood they would breed and pass on the tuskless trait to their offspring.
writtenSummary:
Ivory poaching has led to the evolution of tuskless elephants, proving that humans are “changing the anatomy” of wild animals.
Elephants with tusks were highly likely to be hunted during the Mozambican civil war.
Those without tusks were left alone, leading to an increased likelihood they would breed and pass on the tuskless trait to their offspring.

title: Cambridge University college hands back looted cockerel to Nigeria
writtenTitle: Cambridge University college hands back looted cockerel to Nigeria
summary:
The master of a Cambridge University college has returned the looted bronze cockerel to representatives of Nigeria.
The statue, known as the "Okukur", was taken by British colonial forces in 1897 and given to Jesus College in 1905 by the father of a student.
A decision for it to be returned was made in 2019 after students campaigned.
writtenSummary:
The master of a Cambridge University college has returned the looted bronze cockerel to representatives of Nigeria.
The statue, known as the "Okukur", was taken by British colonial forces in 1897 and given to Jesus College in 1905 by the father of a student.
A decision for it to be returned was made in 2019 after students campaigned.

title: Mystery of the environmental triggers for cancer deepens
writtenTitle: Mystery of the environmental triggers for cancer deepens
summary:
Scientists will have to rethink how environmental triggers allow tumours to form and develop, one of Britain’s leading cancer experts has warned.
Recent results from a study indicated our knowledge of why tumours form is still inadequate.
The research was aimed at uncovering why certain parts of the world suffer extremely high rates of the disease.
writtenSummary:
Scientists will have to rethink how environmental triggers allow tumours to form and develop, one of Britain’s leading cancer experts has warned. 
Recent results from a study indicated our knowledge of why tumours form is still inadequate. 
The research was aimed at uncovering why certain parts of the world suffer extremely high rates of the disease.

title: Mummy’s older than we thought: new find could rewrite history
writtenTitle: Mummy’s older than we thought: new find could rewrite history
summary:
Egyptians were carrying out sophisticated mummifications of their dead 1,000 years earlier than previously thought.
The preserved body of Khuwy has been found to be far older than assumed and is, in fact, one of the oldest Egyptian mummies ever discovered.
The mummy is impregnated with high-quality resins and wrapped in the highest grade of bandages.
writtenSummary:
Egyptians were carrying out sophisticated mummifications of their dead 1,000 years earlier than previously thought.
The preserved body of Khuwy has been found to be far older than assumed and is, in fact, one of the oldest Egyptian mummies ever discovered.
The mummy is impregnated with high-quality resins and wrapped in the highest grade of bandages.

title: Singing lemurs have a distinctly human sense of rhythm, study finds
writtenTitle: Singing lemurs have a distinctly human sense of rhythm, study finds
summary:
Indris, a large, critically endangered species of lemur, have a fascinating trait: an unexpected sense of rhythm.
The creatures often strike up a song with members of their family either in duets or choruses, featuring sounds from roars to wails.
The rhythms are distinctive and predictable patterns of intervals between the onset of notes.
writtenSummary:
Indris, a large, critically endangered species of lemur, have a fascinating trait: an unexpected sense of rhythm.
The creatures often strike up a song with members of their family either in duets or choruses, featuring sounds from roars to wails.
The rhythms are essentially distinctive and predictable patterns of intervals between the onset of notes.

title: SpaceX to fix leaky toilets before astronauts blast off at weekend
writtenTitle: SpaceX to fix leaky toilets before astronauts blast off at weekend
summary:
SpaceX and Nasa want to make sure the toilet leaks will not compromise the capsule launching on Sunday from Kennedy Space Center.
A tube came unglued during SpaceX’s first private flight last month, spilling urine on to fans and beneath the floor.
Sunday’s launch will mark SpaceX’s 4th launch of Nasa astronauts and its 5th passenger flight.
writtenSummary:
SpaceX and Nasa want to make sure the toilet leaks will not compromise the capsule launching on Sunday from Kennedy Space Center. 
A tube came unglued during SpaceX’s first private flight last month, spilling urine on to fans and beneath the floor. 
Sunday’s launch will mark SpaceX’s 4th launch of Nasa astronauts and its 5th passenger flight overall.

title: Haiti gang leader demands PM resign amid harsh fuel shortages
writtenTitle: Haiti gang leader demands PM resign amid harsh fuel shortages
summary:
Cherizier has demanded that PM Ariel Henry resign, as gas stations remain empty and gangs blocked entry to ports holding fuel stores.
Cherizier’s statements show how gangs have taken on an increasingly political role following the July assassination of President Moise.
He said Henry should “answer questions” linking him to Moise’s murder.
writtenSummary:
Cherizier has demanded that PM Ariel Henry resign, as gas stations remain empty and gangs blocked entry to ports holding fuel stores.
Cherizier’s statements show how gangs have taken on an increasingly political role following the July assassination of President Moise.
Cherizier has said Henry should “answer questions” linking him to Moise’s murder.

title: Dozens arrested as indigenous people lead mass Ecuador protests
writtenTitle: Dozens arrested as Indigenous people lead mass Ecuador protests
summary:
People are unhappy with the economic policies of Prez Lasso and want fuel price hikes reversed.
Just days before the COP26 climate summit begins, environmentalists have lambasted Lasso for committing to double Ecuador’s oil production during his term.
With the intention to combat crime and violence, Lasso has declared a 60-day state of emergency.

People are unhappy with the economic policies of Prez Lasso and want fuel price hikes reversed.

title: Islamic State in Afghanistan could attack US in 6 months: Pentagon
writtenTitle: Islamic State in Afghanistan could be able to attack U.S.
summary:
A Pentagon official Kahl said the US intelligence community has assessed that Afghan Islamic State could attack the US in 6 months.
It is a reminder that Afghan could still pose national security concerns for the US even after it ended its war in defeat.
Kahl said it is unclear whether the Taliban has the ability to fight Islamic State.
writtenSummary:
A Pentagon official Kahl said the US intelligence community has assessed that Afghan Islamic State could attack the US in 6  months.
It is a reminder that Afghan could still pose national security concerns for the US even after it ended its war in defeat.
Kahl said it is unclear whether the Taliban has the ability to fight Islamic State.

title: Egypt detains artist robot Ai-Da before historic pyramid show
writtenTitle: Egypt detains artist robot Ai-Da before historic pyramid show
summary:
Ai-Da, the world’s first ultra-realistic robot artist hit a temporary snag before her latest exhibition when Egyptian security forces detained her.
Due to security issues over the cameras in her eyes, both Ai-Da and her sculpture were held in customs for 10 days.
This sparked a diplomatic uproar and prompted her creator to deny that she was a spy.
writtenSummary:
Ai-Da, the world’s first ultra-realistic robot artist hit a temporary snag before her latest exhibition when Egyptian security forces detained her.
Due to security issues over the cameras in her eyes, both Ai-Da and her sculpture were held in customs for 10 days.
This sparked a diplomatic uproar and prompted her creator to deny that she was a spy.

title: Activists disrupt Paris climate finance meeting before COP26
writtenTitle: Activists disrupt Paris climate finance meeting before COP26
summary:
Activists disrupted a green finance summit in Paris, saying that President Macron had failed to get serious on investing in combating climate change.
Protesters intervened with one holding a banner reading "Macron: champion of fossil fuel finance."
The govt says it is committed to meeting its climate targets, including going carbon neutral by 2050.
writtenSummary:
Activists disrupted a green finance summit in Paris, saying that President Macron had failed to get serious on investing in combating climate change.
Protesters intervened with one holding a banner reading "Macron: champion of fossil fuel finance."
The govt says it is committed to meeting its climate targets, including going carbon neutral by 2050.

title: India: Bengal govt bans sale and use of firecrackers on Diwali
writtenTitle: India: Bengal govt bans sale and use of firecrackers on Diwali
summary:
The West Bengal govt imposed a ban on the sale and bursting of firecrackers during upcoming festivals, keeping in mind the health conditions of Covid-19 patients in home isolation.
However, only green crackers would be allowed to be used to reduce air pollution across the state.
These crackers can only be used for a 2-hour window.
writtenSummary:
The West Bengal govt imposed a ban on the sale and bursting of firecrackers during upcoming festivals, keeping in mind the health conditions of Covid-19 patients in home isolation. 
However, only green crackers would be allowed to be used to reduce air pollution across the state.
These crackers can only be used for a 2-hour window.

title: US begins legal appeal to get Julian Assange extradited
writtenTitle: US begins legal appeal to get Julian Assange extradited
summary:
The US government is appealing against the January ruling that blocked Julian Assange's extradition to the US.
Lawyers for the US have told the High Court that the judge who blocked Julian Assange's extradition was misled by his psychiatrist.
Assange is wanted over the publication of thousands of classified documents in 2010 and 2011.
writtenSummary:
The US government is appealing against the January ruling that blocked Julian Assange's extradition to the US.
Lawyers for the US have told the High Court that the judge who blocked Julian Assange's extradition was misled by his psychiatrist.
Mr Assange is wanted over the publication of thousands of classified documents in 2010 and 2011.

title: Poland told to pay €1m a day in legal row with EU
writtenTitle: Poland told to pay €1m a day in legal row with EU
summary:
Poland has been ordered to pay a daily fine of €1m (£850,000) in an row over judicial reforms.
The EU claims recent action from Poland has weakened the independence of its courts.
The European Court of Justice (ECJ) delivered an interim ruling that Poland should suspend the chamber as it was neither sufficiently independent nor impartial.

title: How the Netherlands is turning its back on natural gas
writtenTitle: How the Netherlands is turning its back on natural gas
summary:
Natural gas has provided the Netherlands with cheap heat for generations.
As the country's largest gas field slowly closes down, a wealth of clean alternatives are opening up to keep homes warm.
The scale of the challenge is immense: the government hopes that these pilots will show the country how to meet its goal of getting off fossil fuels by 2050.
writtenSummary:
Natural gas has provided the Netherlands with cheap heat for generations.

The scale of the challenge is immense: the government hopes that these pilots will show the country how to meet its goal of getting off fossil fuels by 2050.

title: UK: Sunak's Budget plans affect you
writtenTitle: UK Budget 2021: Eight ways Sunak's plans affect you
summary:
If you are working and also receiving universal credit, then you are probably affected by what is officially known as the taper rate.
There were no measures to assist householders with rising domestic gas and electricity bills.
Inflation and cost of living are expected to rise by 4% over the next year according to official forecasters.

title: UK: Ministers bow to pressure and pledge to keep sewage out of waters
writtenTitle: Ministers bow to pressure and pledge to keep sewage out of waters
summary:
Ministers have bowed to pressure to clean up rivers and the seas.
They announced a plan to impose a duty on water companies to reduce the impact of sewage discharges from storm overflows.
The Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs submitted an amendment to the Environment Bill to ensure water companies reduce sewage discharges.
writtenSummary:
Ministers have bowed to pressure to clean up rivers and the seas.  
Ministers announced a plan to impose a duty on water companies to reduce the impact of sewage discharges from storm overflows.
The Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs submitted an amendment to the Environment Bill to ensure water companies reduce sewage discharges.

title: Your selfie addiction is contributing to climate change
writtenTitle: Your selfie addiction is contributing to climate change
summary:
Brits take almost 900 photos a year, with dozens of duplicates left in storage.
Selfies rack up the same carbon emissions of 112,000 return flights from London to Perth - 355,000 tonnes.
Deleting duplicates, unsubscribing from emails, turning the video off and on, zooming and cleaning out cloud storage can all help slash emissions.
writtenSummary:
Brits take almost 900 photos a year, with dozens of duplicates left in storage.

title: Sweden probes foreign adoptions over possible abuses
writtenTitle: Sweden probes foreign adoptions over possible abuses
summary:
Sweden will launch an investigation into the adoption of thousands of foreign children since the 1950s.
Around 60,000 children were given to adoptive parents in Sweden since WW II, mostly from S. Korea, India, Colombia and Sri Lanka.
Swedish media raised concerns that children were stolen and forcibly placed for adoption.
writtenSummary:
Sweden will launch an investigation into the adoption of thousands of foreign children since the 1950s.
Around 60,000 children were given to adoptive parents in Sweden since WW II, mostly from S. Korea, India, Colombia, and Sri Lanka.
Swedish media raised concerns that children were stolen and forcibly placed for adoption.

title: France to step up customs checks if UK withholds fishing licences
writtenTitle: France to step up customs checks if UK withholds fishing licences
summary:
France said it would disrupt trade with Britain from Nov 2 unless London agreed to grant more licences to its fishermen to operate in UK waters.
This would include systematic customs and sanitary checks on products brought to France and a ban on seafood.
The flare-up on fishing is the latest in a series of disagreements between the neighbours.
writtenSummary:
France said it would disrupt trade with Britain from Nov 2 unless London agreed to grant more licences to its fishermen to operate in UK waters.
This would include systematic customs and sanitary checks on products brought to France and a ban on seafood.
The flare-up on fishing is the latest in a series of disagreements between the neighbours.

title: European Court of Justice fines Poland over judicial reforms
writtenTitle: European Court of Justice fines Poland over judicial reforms
summary:
ECJ ordered Poland to pay a fine of €1 million/day over its decision to ignore an EU ruling on Warsaw's judicial reforms.
The penalty was imposed as Poland has not suspended the disciplinary chamber of its SC, which allows for the dismissal of judges on political grounds.
Other EU nations insisted that Poland not be allowed to collect EU subsidies.
writtenSummary:
ECJ ordered Poland to pay a fine of €1 million/day over its decision to ignore an EU ruling on Warsaw's judicial reforms.
The penalty was imposed as Poland has not suspended the disciplinary chamber of its SC, which allows for the dismissal of judges on political grounds.
Other EU nations insisted that Poland not be allowed to collect EU subsidies.

title: Germany: Probe starts on sexual abuse in Protestant Church
writtenTitle: Germany: Probe starts on sexual abuse in Protestant Church
summary:
A group of independent researchers presented details of an investigation into sexual abuse in the church and its related charities. 
The aim of the study is to analyse the structural and systemic conditions that have facilitated abuse in the Protestant Church.
The Evangelische Kirche in Deutschland has provided €3.6 million in funding for the study.
writtenSummary:
A group of independent researchers presented details of an investigation into sexual abuse in the church and its related charities. 
The aim of the study is to analyse the structural and systemic conditions that have facilitated abuse with the Protestant Church
The Evangelische Kirche in Deutschland has provided €3.6 million in funding for the study.

title: Germany: Hendrik Wüst to take helm of most populous state
writtenTitle: Germany: Hendrik Wüst to take helm of most populous state
summary:
The North Rhine-Westphalia elected politician Hendrik Wüst, a member of the conservative Christian Democratic Union, as the region's new premier.
Wüst was elected with 103 votes in favour and 90 against in the assembly of 197 seats.
He has major tasks ahead, including dealing with the pandemic and rebuilding after the devastating floods in July.
writtenSummary:
The North Rhine-Westphalia elected politician Hendrik Wüst, a member of the conservative Christian Democratic Union, as the region's new premier.
Wüst was elected with 103 votes in favour and 90 against in the assembly of 197 seats.
He said, has major tasks ahead, including dealing with the pandemic and rebuilding after devastating flooding in July.

title: China limits construction of 'super high-rise buildings'
writtenTitle: China limits construction of 'super high-rise buildings'
summary:
China has restricted smaller cities in the country from building "super high-rise buildings", as part of a larger bid to crack down on vanity projects.
The country is home to some of the world's highest buildings, including Shanghai Tower, which has 128 floors.
There is already an existing ban on buildings taller than 500m and on ugly architecture.
writtenSummary:
China has restricted smaller cities in the country from building "super high-rise buildings", as part of a larger bid to crack down on vanity projects.
The country is home to some of the world's highest buildings, including Shanghai Tower, which has 128 floors.
There is already an existing ban on buildings taller than 500m and on ugly architecture.

title: Russia: Moscow shops and restaurants shut in partial lockdown
writtenTitle: Covid: Moscow shops and restaurants shut in partial lockdown
summary:
Shops, restaurants and schools have shut in Moscow in a partial lockdown, as Russia battles record Covid deaths and infections.
Only essential shops like supermarkets and pharmacies are allowed to open, while food outlets are only providing takeaways.
Workers across Russia were given nine days off from Saturday in a bid to curb Covid-19 infections.
writtenSummary:
Shops, restaurants, and schools have shut in Moscow in a partial lockdown, as Russia battles record Covid deaths and infections.
Only essential shops like supermarkets and pharmacies are allowed to open, while food outlets are only providing takeaways.
Workers across Russia were given nine days off from Saturday in a bid to curb infections.

title: China rations diesel amid fuel shortages
writtenTitle: China rations diesel amid fuel shortages
summary:
Petrol stations in China have begun rationing diesel amid rising costs and falling supplies.
China is in the midst of a massive power crunch, like coal and natural gas shortages have closed factories, and left homes without power.
Depending on the duration and intensity of this crunch, it could contribute to the global supply chain challenges.
writtenSummary:
Petrol stations in China have begun rationing diesel amid rising costs and falling supplies.
China is in the midst of a massive power crunch, like coal and natural gas shortages have closed factories and left homes without power.
Depending on the duration and intensity of this crunch, it could contribute to the global supply chain challenges.

title: Indians celebrating Pakistan’s victory in cricket will face charges
writtenTitle: Indians celebrating Pakistan’s victory in cricket will face charges
summary:
UP CM Yogi Adityanath has asserted that those celebrating Pakistan’s victory in the T20 cricket will face sedition charges.
His comments come a day after 3 engineering students from Kashmir were arrested for raising anti-national slogans following Pakistan’s win.
UP police have booked a total of 7 people for allegedly raising Pro-Pak slogans.
writtenSummary:
UP CM Yogi Adityanath has asserted that those celebrating Pakistan’s victory in the T20 cricket will face sedition charges.
His comments come a day after 3 engineering students from Kashmir were arrested for raising anti-national slogans following Pakistan’s win.
UP police have booked a total of 7 people for allegedly raising Pro-Pak slogans.

title: African Union, World Bank suspend Sudan over military coup
writtenTitle: African Union, World Bank suspend Sudan over military coup
summary:
The AU said it had suspended Sudan until civilian rule in the country is restored, saying it rejected the military takeover as an unconstitutional seizure of power.
The World Bank also decided to suspend aid to Sudan.
Many western powers called for a meeting with PM Hamdok, as they still recognise his cabinet as the constitutional leaders of Sudan.
writtenSummary:
The AU said it had suspended Sudan until civilian rule in the country is restored, saying it rejected the military takeover as an unconstitutional seizure of power.
The World Bank also decided to suspend aid to Sudan
Many western powers called for a meeting with PM Hamdok, as they still recognise his cabinet as the constitutional leaders of Sudan.

title: Row over Brexit fishing escalates: UK fishing boat detained by France
writtenTitle: Row over Brexit fishing escalates: UK fishing boat detained by France
summary:
A British trawler has been seized by France and another has been fined, amid an escalating row over post-Brexit fishing rights.
No 10 said it was watching events closely and wanted France and EU talks but was ready to respond appropriately.
France authorities say the boat was fishing without a licence, claims that the UK and the fishing company deny.
writtenSummary:
A British trawler has been seized by France and another has been fined, amid an escalating row over post-Brexit fishing rights.
No 10 said it was watching events closely and wanted France and EU talks but was ready to respond appropriately.
France authorities say the boat was fishing without a licence, claims that the UK and the fishing company deny.

title: All countries to be removed from England's travel red list
writtenTitle: Covid: All countries to be removed from England's travel red list
summary:
The remaining seven countries on England's Covid travel red list are set to be removed, the BBC understands.
Passengers arriving from Colombia, Peru, Panama, the Dominican Republic, Haiti, Venezuela and Ecuador will soon no longer have to quarantine in a hotel for 10 full days.
Travel experts say that the best approach is to check vaccines.
writtenSummary:
The remaining seven countries on England's Covid travel red list are set to be removed, the BBC understands.
Passengers arriving from Colombia, Peru, Panama, the Dominican Republic, Haiti, Venezuela and Ecuador will soon no longer have to quarantine in a hotel for 10 full days.
Travel experts say that the best approach is to check vaccines.

title: More than a million British households get mystery Amazon packages
writtenTitle: More than a million British households get mystery Amazon packages
summary:
More than a million British may have fallen victim to “brushing” scams after receiving Amazon packages from companies trying to boost their numbers.
The consumer watchdog said the parcels appear to have been sent by third-party sellers.
Amazon says the scams were being “orchestrated by bad actors” who had obtained shoppers’ personal details.
writtenSummary:
More than a million British may have fallen victim to “brushing” scams after receiving Amazon packages from companies trying to boost their numbers.
The consumer watchdog said the parcels appear to have been sent by third-party sellers.
Amazon says the scams were being “orchestrated by bad actors” who had obtained shoppers’ personal details.

title: Emiliano Sala: Flight organiser convicted over plane deaths
writtenTitle: Emiliano Sala: Flight organiser convicted over plane deaths
summary:
The organiser of the flight in which footballer Emiliano Sala died has been found guilty of endangering the safety of an aircraft.
Sala, 28, and pilot David Ibbotson, 59, died in the crash in the English Channel in January 2019.
David Henderson, 67, of Hotham, East Riding of Yorkshire, was found guilty after a trial at Cardiff Crown Court.
writtenSummary:
The organiser of the flight in which footballer Emiliano Sala died has been found guilty of endangering the safety of an aircraft.
Sala, 28, and pilot David Ibbotson, 59, died in the crash in the English Channel in January 2019.
David Henderson, 67, of Hotham, East Riding of Yorkshire, was found guilty after a trial at Cardiff Crown Court.

title: UK: Millions will be worse off in 2022
writtenTitle: Budget 2021: Millions will be worse off in 2022
summary:
Millions are set to be worse off next year amid spiraling costs and tax rises.
The Institute for Fiscal Studies (IFS) said that inflation and higher taxes on incomes would negate small wage increases for middle earners.
Low-income households will also feel "real pain" as the cost of living is set to increase faster than benefit payments, it said.
writtenSummary:
Millions are set to be worse off next year amid spiraling costs and tax rises.
The Institute for Fiscal Studies (IFS) said that inflation and higher taxes on incomes would negate small wage increases for middle earners.
Low-income households will also feel "real pain" as the cost of living is set to increase faster than benefit payments, it said.

title: Neutrino result heralds new chapter in physics
writtenTitle: Neutrino result heralds new chapter in physics
summary:
A major experiment has been used to search for an elusive sub-atomic particle, a key component of the matter that makes up our everyday lives.
The search failed to find the particle, known as the sterile neutrino.
This will now direct physicists towards even more interesting theories to help explain how the Universe came to be.
writtenSummary:
A major experiment has been used to search for an elusive sub-atomic particle, a key component of the matter that makes up our everyday lives.
The search failed to find the particle, known as the sterile neutrino.
This will now direct physicists towards even more interesting theories to help explain how the Universe came to be.

title: France to use language of force in post-Brexit fishing rights row
writtenTitle: France to use ‘language of force’ in post-Brexit fishing rights row
summary:
Tension over post-Brexit fishing rights have escalated between France and the UK.
The response of authorities in the UK and Jersey to post-Brexit applications from French fishing vessels for permits to its waters has infuriated Paris.
Paris said it would ban British fishing boats in key ports from Tuesday unless it received further licences.
writtenSummary:
Tension over post-Brexit fishing rights have escalated between France and the UK.
The response of authorities in the UK and Jersey to post-Brexit applications from French fishing vessels for permits to its waters has infuriated Paris.
Paris said it would ban British fishing boats in key ports from Tuesday unless it received further licences.

title: World is failing to make changes needed to avoid climate breakdown
writtenTitle: World is failing to make changes needed to avoid climate breakdown
summary:
The world needs to reduce emissions to meet the goals of the Paris climate agreement.
Pace of emissions reductions must be increased significantly to keep global heating to 1.5C.
If the world warms up at a rate dictated by current policies, there will be an "abrupt jump" in the pace of Antarctic ice loss around 2060.
writtenSummary:
The world needs to reduce emissions to meet the goals of the Paris climate agreement.
Pace of emissions reductions must be increased significantly to keep global heating to 1.5C.
If the world warms up at a rate dictated by current policies, there will be an "abrupt jump" in the pace of Antarctic ice loss around 2060.

title: Nipah virus: could it cause the next pandemic?
writtenTitle: Nipah virus: could it cause the next pandemic?
summary:
There is no vaccine or tried-and-tested treatment for Nipah.
A recent outbreak of Nipah virus in India has raised the question of whether we should start to consider it as a future threat.
Its natural host is the fruit bat, the large and small flying foxes which are distributed across South and Southeast Asia.
writtenSummary:
There is no vaccine or tried-and-tested treatment for Nipah.
A recent outbreak of Nipah virus in India has raised the question of whether we should start to consider it as a future threat.
 Its natural host is the fruit bat, the large and small flying foxes which are distributed across South and Southeast Asia.

title: 'Empty shelves in Germany!' Panic in EU as shortage hell hits
writtenTitle: 'Empty shelves in Germany!' Panic in EU as shortage hell hits
summary:
Germany is experiencing a shortage of drivers severe enough to spark fear supermarket shelves will soon be empty across the country.
The EU is worried about running out of supplies amid a worrying shortage of lorry drivers.
The nation's media has branded the issue the "British mega problem" due to the UK supply chain problems.
writtenSummary:
Germany is experiencing a shortage of drivers severe enough to spark fear supermarket shelves will soon be empty across the country.
The EU is worried about running out of supplies amid a worrying shortage of lorry drivers.
The nation's media has branded the issue the "British mega problem" due to the UK supply chain problems.

title: Saudi chemical giant to invest nearly £1bn in UK's Teesside plant
writtenTitle: Saudi chemical giant to invest nearly £1bn in Teesside plant
summary:
Saudi Arabian manufacturing and chemicals giant Sabic is to invest almost £1bn at its Teesside plant.
It is one of the world's largest petrochemical manufacturers, and the cash injection was part of its plans to reduce its carbon footprint by upto 60% initially.
UK’s PM said the investment was a huge vote of confidence in the UK's chemicals industry.
writtenSummary:
Saudi Arabian manufacturing and chemicals giant Sabic is to invest almost £1bn at its Teesside plant.
It is one of the world's largest petrochemical manufacturers, and the cash injection was part of its plans to reduce its carbon footprint by upto 60% initially.
UK’s PM said the investment was a huge vote of confidence in the UK's chemicals industry.

title: Sitting Bull: DNA confirms great-grandson's identity
writtenTitle: Sitting Bull: DNA confirms great-grandson's identity
summary:
A sample of hair belonging to the legendary 19th century Native American leader Sitting Bull has allowed scientists to confirm that a South Dakota man is his great-grandson.
Scientists took DNA from a tiny sample of Sitting Bull's hair that had been stored in Washington DC.
It showed that Ernie LaPointe, 73, is his great-grandson.
writtenSummary:
A sample of hair belonging to the legendary 19th century Native American leader Sitting Bull has allowed scientists to confirm that a South Dakota man is his great-grandson.
Scientists took DNA from a tiny sample of Sitting Bull's hair that had been stored in Washington DC.
It showed that Ernie LaPointe, 73, is his great-grandson.

title: Scrapping submarines deal broke trust, Macron tells Australian PM
writtenTitle: Scrapping submarines deal broke trust, Macron tells Australian PM
summary:
Macron told Morrison that scrapping a multibillion-dollar submarine contract “broke the relationship of trust”.
Macron encouraged the PM to adopt a more ambitious climate policy and “to cease production and consumption of coal”.
Morrison’s office issued a statement saying he was “was pleased to be able to speak with President Macron”.
writtenSummary:

Morrison’s office issued a statement saying he was “was pleased to be able to speak with President Macron”.

title: Bangladeshis adapt to survive with floating farms, salt-resistant rice
writtenTitle: Bangladeshis adapt to survive with floating farms, salt-resistant rice
summary:
Rising sea levels and violent flooding are already putting tens of millions of lives at risk in Bangladesh.
Water-logged land and high salinity in streams and soil are killing crops.
Farmers are desperately trying to adjust to these destructive conditions caused by global warming by using floating seedbeds to develop salt-resistant rice.
writtenSummary:

title: Facebook changes its name to Meta in major rebrand
writtenTitle: Facebook changes its name to Meta in major rebrand
summary:
Facebook has changed its name to better encompass what it does, as it broadens its reach beyond social media into areas like virtual reality.
The change does not apply to its individual platforms, such as Facebook, Instagram and Whatsapp.
The move follows a series of negative stories about Facebook, based on documents leaked by an ex-employee.
writtenSummary:
Facebook has changed its name to better encompass what it does, as it broadens its reach beyond social media into areas like virtual reality.
The change does not apply to its individual platforms, such as Facebook, Instagram and Whatsapp
The move follows a series of negative stories about Facebook, based on documents leaked by an ex-employee.

title: Universities record drop in  EU students post-Brexit
writtenTitle: Universities see EU students halve post-Brexit as non-EU numbers rise
summary:
David Richardson, a vice chancellor, said University of East Anglia's EU student numbers had dropped by 50% in 2021.
He said international students were vital, a single year's cohort will contribute over £100m to the region.
International students are vital to the UK economy, with first-year students contributing £28.8bn to the national economy.

David Richardson said EU student numbers had dropped by 50% in 2021 "across the sector nationally"
Richardson said international students were vital, "a single year's cohort will contribute over £100m to the region”

title: Why do people believe Covid conspiracy theories?
writtenTitle: Why do people believe Covid conspiracy theories?
summary:
Researchers used AI and witchcraft folklore to map the coronavirus conspiracy theories that have sprung up.
One discovery from the research identifies Bill Gates as the reason why conspiracy theorists connect 5G with the virus.
It’s Gates’ world-spanning influence in tech and then health that lodges him at the heart of a lot of conspiracies.
writtenSummary:
Researchers used AI – and witchcraft folklore – to map the coronavirus conspiracy theories that have sprung up. 
One discovery from the research identifies Bill Gates as the reason why conspiracy theorists connect 5G with the virus. 
It’s Gates’ world-spanning influence in tech and then health that lodges him at the heart of a lot of conspiracies.

title: Mark Zuckerberg on why Facebook is rebranding to Meta
writtenTitle: Mark Zuckerberg on why Facebook is rebranding to Meta
summary:
The rebrand is about solidifying the social media giant as being about the metaverse, which Zuckerberg sees as the future of the internet.
Zuckerberg has been pouring billions of dollars, at least $10 bn this year alone, into building the metaverse.
The company wants to move past the "confusion and awkwardness" of sharing a name with its main app.
writtenSummary:
The rebrand is about solidifying the social media giant as being about the metaverse, which Zuckerberg sees as the future of the internet.
Zuckerberg has been pouring billions of dollars — at least $10 bn this year alone — into building the metaverse. 
The company wants to move past the "confusion and awkwardness" of sharing a name with its main app.

title: Amazon spending "several billion" to avoid holiday shipping delays
writtenTitle: Amazon spending "several billion" to avoid holiday shipping delays
summary:
Amazon will spend “several billion dollars” to avoid problems during the holidays, which might extend from product delivery issues to keeping items in stock.
Amazon’s earnings disappointed investors with a major dip in quarterly profits from last year, largely due to increased spending across the board.
CEO Jassy said these expenses were necessary.
writtenSummary:

title: US: Biden lands in Europe with domestic spending plans in limbo
writtenTitle: US: Biden lands in Europe with domestic spending plans in limbo
summary:
President Biden has arrived in Rome for a G20 summit and will head to a UK climate conference on Sunday.
He had hoped to trumpet a bumper environmental package to world leaders at a UK climate conference.
Biden will seek to project the message that the US is back in the fight against global warming after Trump withdrew from the Paris climate accord.
writtenSummary:

Biden will seek to project the message that the US is back in the fight against global warming after Trump withdrew from the Paris climate accord.

title: European Union is three generations away from gender equality
writtenTitle: European Union is three generations away from gender equality
summary:
A report on gender equality in the EU revealed a dismal rate of improvement in recent years.
EU scored 68 points out of 100 in the 2021 Gender-Equality Index which marked an improvement of just 0.6 points over 2020, and under 5 points in the past 11 yrs.
Covid pandemic may have slowed advancement and put the fragile gains in gender equality at risk.

title: Germany: Inflation reaches 28-year high amid surge in energy prices
writtenTitle: Germany: Inflation reaches 28-year high amid surge in energy prices
summary:
The annual inflation rate accelerated for the fourth month in a row, hitting 4.5% in October.
The energy price hike has been cited by experts as the main reason for the overall increase in consumer prices.
While inflation is helping firms to improve corporate margins that have suffered due to the pandemic, consumers are being hit in their pockets.
writtenSummary:
The annual inflation rate accelerated for the fourth month in a row, hitting 4.5% in October. 
The energy price hike has been cited by experts as the main reason for the overall increase in consumer prices.
While inflation is helping firms to improve corporate margins that have suffered due to the pandemic, consumers are being hit in their pockets.

title: UN: Asia's biggest drug bust, Laos Police seize 55 million Meth pills
writtenTitle: UN: Asia's biggest drug bust, Laos Police seize 55 million Meth pills
summary:
Laotian police carried out Asia's biggest-ever single seizure of illegal drugs, finding more than 55 million methamphetamine pills in a beer truck.
Laos has been a gateway for drug traffickers moving meth shipments out of Myanmar's Shan state into Thailand and beyond.
Parts of the Shan state are controlled by ethnic armed groups and their civilians.
writtenSummary:
Laotian police carried out Asia's biggest-ever single seizure of illegal drugs, finding more than 55 million methamphetamine pills in a beer truck.

title: US issues first gender-neutral 'X' passport
writtenTitle: US issues first gender-neutral 'X' passport
summary:
The US has issued its first gender-neutral passport, which has an "X" in the gender box.
It was issued to Dana Zzyym, a 66-year-old intersex activist, who sued the State Department over the issue in 2015.
The move, which gives choice to nonbinary, intersex and gender-nonconforming US citizens, is the latest move in President Joe Biden's LGBT agenda.
writtenSummary:
The US has issued its first gender-neutral passport, which has an "X" in the gender box.
It was issued to Dana Zzyym, a 66-year-old intersex activist, who sued the State Department over the issue in 2015.
The move, which gives choice to nonbinary, intersex and gender-nonconforming US citizens, is the latest move in President Joe Biden's LGBT agenda.

title: Fishing row: UK warns France it could retaliate over threats
writtenTitle: Fishing row: UK warns France it could retaliate over threats
summary:
The UK could respond in turn if France goes ahead with threats amid a row over post-Brexit fishing rights.
France has said it could stop British boats from landing if the dispute was not resolved by Tuesday.
The environment secretary said he was raising the issue with the European Commission, while France's ambassador has been summoned for talks.
writtenSummary:
The UK could respond in turn if France goes ahead with threats amid a row over post-Brexit fishing rights.
France has said it could stop British boats from landing if the dispute was not resolved by Tuesday.
The environment secretary said he was raising the issue with the European Commission, while France's ambassador has been summoned for talks.

title: US: New Biden plan gives e-bike buyers up to $1,500 in tax credits
writtenTitle: New Biden plan would give e-bike buyers up to $1,500 in tax credits
summary:
The current Build Back Better proposal would offer Americans a refundable tax credit worth 30% of a new e-bike’s purchase price, capped at $1,500.
E-bikes are more expensive than normal bikes, but they also have the potential to replace car trips for a lot of people.
A study found if 15% of car trips were made by e-bike, emissions would drop by 12%.
writtenSummary:
The current Build Back Better proposal would offer Americans a refundable tax credit worth 30% of a new e-bike’s purchase price, capped at $1,500. 
E-bikes are more expensive than normal bikes, but they also have the potential to replace car trips for a lot of people.
A study found if 15% of car trips were made by e-bike, emissions would drop by 12%.

title: DNA reveals unexpected origins of mummies buried in a Chinese desert
writtenTitle: DNA reveals unexpected origins of mummies buried in a Chinese desert
summary:
The mummies' bodies and clothes are intact despite being up to 4,000 years old.
Their looks and clothing suggested they were long-distance herders from the West Asia steppe or migrating farmers from the mountains and desert oases of Central Asia.
A new study says the remains belong to a local group descended from an ancient ice age Asian population.
writtenSummary:
The mummies' bodies and clothes are intact despite being up to 4,000 years old.
Their looks and clothing suggested they were long-distance herders from the West Asia steppe or migrating farmers from the mountains and desert oases of Central Asia. 
A new study says the remains belong to a local group descended from an ancient ice age Asian population.

title: Energy price cap to be reviewed as firms go bust
writtenTitle: Energy price cap to be reviewed as firms go bust
summary:
The UK energy watchdog will review how the price cap on gas and electricity bills is calculated following a series of company failures.
Ofgem said there had been an "unprecedented" rise in wholesale energy prices.
Suppliers are unable to pass on the full rise to consumers because of a price cap on household bills, prompting a number to collapse.
writtenSummary:

Suppliers are unable to pass on the full rise to consumers because of a price cap on household bills, prompting a number to collapse.

title: Italian company Ferrero accused of exploiting hazelnut pickers
writtenTitle: Italian company Ferrero accused of exploiting hazelnut pickers
summary:
Turkish hazelnut producers are denouncing the poor working conditions of Italy's Ferrero.
Farmers picking most of the hazelnuts going into Nutella spreads complain of exploitation and meagre pay, setting up a clash over labour rights.
They are paid $14 a day for 12 hrs, which is less than the minimum wage that Turkey requires for a 45-hour week.
writtenSummary:
Turkish hazelnut producers are denouncing the poor working conditions of Italy's Ferrero.
Farmers picking most of the hazelnuts going into Nutella spreads complain of exploitation and meagre pay, setting up a clash over labour rights.
They are paid $14 a day for 12 hrs, which is less than the minimum wage that Turkey requires for a 45-hour week.

title: Saudi child protester who faced death penalty released
writtenTitle: Saudi child protester who faced death penalty released
summary:
Saudi freed Ali al-Nimr, who was sentenced to death for protest-related crimes as a child in a case that had provoked an international outcry.
He was 17 when he was detained in 2012 during anti-govt protests by Shia Muslim minority.
In 2014, a court condemned him to death by crucifixion - beheading followed by the public display of his body.
writtenSummary:
Saudi freed Ali al-Nimr, who was sentenced to death for protest-related crimes as a child in a case that provoked an international outcry.
He was 17 when he was detained in 2012 during anti-govt protests by Shia Muslim minority.
In 2014, a court condemned him to death by crucifixion - beheading followed by the public display of his body.

title: Squid Game cryptocurrency rockets in first few days of trading
writtenTitle: Squid Game cryptocurrency rockets in first few days of trading
summary:
Gamers have created an online version of Squid Game, for which you need the ‘Squid’ cryptocurrency to play.
On Tuesday, it was worth a modest 1 cent, but by Friday it had exploded in value, reaching $4.39 (£3.18).
Squid is known as a "play-to-earn" cryptocurrency, where people buy tokens to play in online games where they can earn more tokens.
writtenSummary:
Gamers have created an online version of Squid Game, for which you need the ‘Squid’ cryptocurrency to play.
